fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: A group of digital music file types produced by a variety of software applications called trackers. Mod files include sequencing information (similar to MIDI_SD) and waveform samples (generally PCM audio), and may be compared to XMF_1_0 files. Information about a variety of mod formats was provided through 2009 at http://pipin.tmd.ns.ac.yu/extra/fileformat/modules/index.htm; several mod file types are enumerated in File type signifiers, below.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: A group of digital music file types produced by a variety of software applications called trackers. Mod files include sequencing information (similar to MIDI_SD) and waveform samples (generally PCM audio), and may be compared to XMF files.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: May be used by composers or arrangers for initial-state activities, in middle-state exchange of data or archiving, or for final-state, end-user delivery.

fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: None established at this time. XMF_1_0 is likely to be preferred to mods.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Various types of mods are encountered on the web. One commentator writes, "Mods are extremely popular in the demo world and offer a way of making music of an acceptable level of quality rather cheaply."
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:licensingAndPatents: None investigated by the compilers of this document.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: None known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:soundQF.fdd:fidelity: Not applicable; fidelity depends upon the performance of external hardware and software.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note:
From the list of extensions and associated tracker programs originally at www.modplug.com and as of late 2013 at resources.openmpt.org/modfaq.
Additional signifier information for some mod types is provided in the following three-row sets.
From the list of extensions and associated tracker programs at resources.openmpt.org.

fdd:urlGroup.fdd:intro: Between July 2012 and December 2013, resources on MOD formats moved from www.modplug.com to resources.openmpt.org.

fdd:urlReference.comment: Site that rescued old resources from modplug.com and hosts discussions on the IT (Impulse Tracker) and S3M formats.

fdd:urlReference.tag: List of extensions and associated tracker programs. Not active.
File Format Encyclopedia (FFE) segment devoted to mod formats
fdd:urlReference.comment: FFE was a resource constructed by Miodrag Milanovic, no longer available online. The entire FFE has been archived as a zipped directory of files at https://archive.org/details/file-format-encyclopedia.

fdd:urlReference.tag: Archived version of File Format Encyclopedia by Miodrag Milanovic.
